properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 7:00PM EST until February 8 at 3:06AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Turkey Creek near Byromville affecting Dooly County


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Turkey Creek near Byromville.
* From this evening until late Friday night.
* At 645 PM Thursday the stage was 9.2 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast to develop.
* Flood stage is 10 feet.
* The creek is forecast to rise above flood stage tonight and then
continue rising, reaching near 10.5 feet Friday morning. The river
is expected to fall below flood stage Friday evening.
* At 10 feet, minor flooding of the woodlands occurs upstream and
downstream from the stream gage on Georgia Highway 90. Portions of
creek access roads and low lying areas will begin to flood.

At 11 feet, minor flooding expands into the woodland areas upstream
and downstream from the stream gage on Georgia Highway 90. Larger
portions of creek access roads will flood.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
